alert.note: Alert for Cannon; Coffee; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 8:20PM CDT until July 12 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR EASTERN MARSHALL...SOUTHERN RUTHERFORD...SOUTHEASTERN WILLIAMSON...COFFEE...BEDFORD AND SOUTHWESTERN CANNON COUNTIES... At 819 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Manchester to Chapel Hill, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. At 815 PM CDT...quarter size hail was reported in Chapel Hill with these storms. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Shelbyville, Manchester, Tullahoma, Chapel Hill, Wartrace, Eagleville, Bell Buckle, Normandy, Christiana, Beechgrove, Raus, Fosterville, Summitville, Rover, Belfast, Deason, Hillsboro, Bradyville, Farmington and Unionville. This includes Interstate 24 between mile markers 87 and 127. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
